attributes.additional_details:
There is much evidence to show that the people of this country are dissatisfied with the way in which the UK is run by politicians of all parties, and in particular, the very high tax liability.
Rather than more of the same at the May 2015 elections and another 5 years of discontent, I suggest that it be a condition upon all parties standing in that election, that they agree to hold a national referendum by the end of 2017, in which the people shall vote not only upon our continued membership of the EU, but on how we the public want this nation to develop in terms of education, welfare, defence etc etc, rather than being told how are taxes will be spent.
